dt: {bc}to make onerous and rigorous demands on
{bc}to assess or determine judicially the amount of (costs in a court action)

dt.t: there went out a decree … that all the world should be {wi}taxed{/wi}

et: Middle English, to estimate, assess, tax, from Anglo-French {it}taxer{/it}, from Medieval Latin {it}taxare{/it}, from Latin, to feel, estimate, censure, frequentative of {it}tangere{/it} to touch {ma}{mat|tangent:2|}{/ma}
shortdef: to make onerous and rigorous demands on

dt: {bc}reflex translational or orientational movement by a freely motile and usually simple organism in relation to a source of stimulation (such as a light or a temperature or chemical gradient)

et: borrowed from German {it}Taxis,{/it} borrowed from Greek {it}táxis{/it} "drawing up in rank and file, order of battle, arrangement, order," from {it}tag-,{/it} stem of {it}tássein{/it} (Attic {it}táttein{/it}) "to draw up in order (as troops, ships), post, station, place in order, prescribe, assess" + {it}-sis{/it} {et_link|-sis|-sis} {ma}{mat|tactic:2|}{/ma}
shortdef: reflex translational or orientational movement by a freely motile and usually simple organism in relation to a source of stimulation (such as a light or a temperature or chemical gradient)
a reflex reaction involving a taxis

dt: {bc}a charge usually of money imposed by authority on persons or property for public purposes
{bc}a sum levied on members of an organization to defray expenses

shortdef: a charge usually of money imposed by authority on persons or property for public purposes
a sum levied on members of an organization to defray expenses

dt: {bc}a U.S. federal income tax that was originally imposed to prevent wealthy taxpayers from using tax shelters to avoid paying taxes, that excludes many deductions and exemptions allowed in computing regular tax liability, and that must be paid instead of the regular tax liability by individuals and businesses whose alternative minimum tax liability is greater than their regular tax liability

shortdef: a U.S. federal income tax that was originally imposed to prevent wealthy taxpayers from using tax shelters to avoid paying taxes, that excludes many deductions and exemptions allowed in computing regular tax liability, and that must be paid instead of the regular tax liability by individuals and businesses whose alternative minimum tax liability is greater than their regular tax liability

dt: {bc}a tax arising on the transmission of property after the owner's death

shortdef: a tax arising on the transmission of property after the owner's death; especially : estate tax

dt: {bc}a tax exacted directly from the taxpayer

shortdef: a tax exacted directly from the taxpayer

dt: {bc}a tax in the form of a percentage of the taxable estate that is imposed on a property owner's right to transfer the property to others after his or her death {dx}compare {dxt|inheritance tax||1}{/dx}

shortdef: a tax in the form of a percentage of the taxable estate that is imposed on a property owner's right to transfer the property to others after his or her death

dt: {bc}a tax that is ultimately paid by someone other than the person on whom it is levied
{bc}an economic inequity that reduces one's real income or buying power

shortdef: a tax that is ultimately paid by someone other than the person on whom it is levied
an economic inequity that reduces one's real income or buying power
